My favourite thing to do at the end of a busy day is to have a long, warm soak in the bath. That’s why I decided to turn my bathroom into my own personal spa! Here are some of the things you’ll need to create your own spa experience.
Soft lighting
There’s something about soft light that’s so soothing. If you have big windows to let in the last rays of evening sunlight, you have everything you need. For everyone else, adding a fresh coat of pastel paint will help create that same even lighting. For late night relaxation, put candles next to your mirror for a gentle glow.
Soothing scents
Every time you breathe in your favourite scent, your body relaxes a little. You can easily add calming scents to your spa time by buying perfumed bath products, but if you really want your bath time to be special, add essential oils, crushed flower petals, herbs or cut fruit to the hot water and the whole room will smell heavenly!
Soft lighting
There’s something about soft light that’s so soothing. If you have big windows to let in the last rays of evening sunlight, you have everything you need. For everyone else, adding a fresh coat of pastel paint will help create that same even lighting. For late night relaxation, put candles next to your mirror for a gentle glow.
Soothing scents
Every time you breathe in your favourite scent, your body relaxes a little. You can easily add calming scents to your spa time by buying perfumed bath products, but if you really want your bath time to be special, add essential oils, crushed flower petals, herbs or cut fruit to the hot water and the whole room will smell heavenly!
Luxurious softness
You can soften the tension in sore muscles by adding Epsom salts to your bath water (just like Grandma used to do), and you can polish away dry skin to reveal the softness underneath using a homemade lemon or lavender sugar scrub. Here’s a quick and easy recipe for you to try.
Your towels, mats and curtains should also be soft, luxurious and matching so that they’re soothing to both your eyes and body. Here’s my favourite bathroom set at the moment.
Luxurious softness
You can soften the tension in sore muscles by adding Epsom salts to your bath water (just like Grandma used to do), and you can polish away dry skin to reveal the softness underneath using a homemade lemon or lavender sugar scrub. Here’s a quick and easy recipe for you to try.
Your towels, mats and curtains should also be soft, luxurious and matching so that they’re soothing to both your eyes and body. Here’s my favourite bathroom set at the moment.
Rainforest elements
If you enjoy the great outdoors, you can add elements of the rainforest for some nature therapy. Hanging plants like orchids, ferns and peace lilies do well in humid shade, so they are perfect for the bathroom. You can even change your shower head to an extra-wide flat one for that wonderful feeling of being caught in a summer rainfall.
Rainforest elements
If you enjoy the great outdoors, you can add elements of the rainforest for some nature therapy. Hanging plants like orchids, ferns and peace lilies do well in humid shade, so they are perfect for the bathroom. You can even change your shower head to an extra-wide flat one for that wonderful feeling of being caught in a summer rainfall.
Your relaxation style
Lie back with your head resting on a rolled-up towel. If you enjoy a cup of herbal tea or a book while you’re in the bath, make sure you have somewhere safe to put these items. The Tallin storage trolley is perfect because it’s just the right height for easy reach, and it has wheels so it’s easy to shift around.
If you’d like to put on some gentle music, I suggest a rechargeable Bluetooth® speaker that doesn’t mind getting a little wet.
Please note: Only relaxing things are allowed in your spa, so leave your phone and your worries outside.

Neatness
Lastly, clutter just ruins the mood, so you’ll want to keep your spa clean, clear and calming. You can make your bath or basin look neater by emptying bath products into beautiful glass bottles or a matching ceramic bathroom set. Hang your towels neatly on elegant hooks or hide extra items in a handy rack behind the door.
If you want your own spa bathroom, you’ll love the bathroom range at HomeChoice. See how you can make your bathroom even better today.
